710144f-a.text:
Eighth Avenue, east side, from 31st to 30th Streets., showing construction work on Eighth Avenue subway.
October 22, 1927.
P.L. Sperr, Photographer.
NEG #3646

711969f-a.text:
30th Street, from Eighth to Ninth Avenues.
September 14, 1928.
P.L. Sperr.

710142f-a.text:
Eighth Ave., west side, north from West 30th to, but not including
31st Streets.
September 14, 1928.
P. L. Sperr.

711968f-a.text:
West 30th Street, north side, at the northwest corner of 6th
Avenue.
P. L. Sperr  September 2, 1940

711970f-a.text:
(1)
329-339 West 30th Street, north side, between Eighth and Ninth Avenues. No. 333 is the Rural New Yorker Building which was
formerly the old Chelsea Methodist Church.
About 1910.
(2)
327-339 West 30th Street, practically the same view as number
one, seen across a clearing from 29th Street.
September 27, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.

711970f-b.text:
(1)
329-339 West 30th Street, north side, between Eighth and Ninth Avenues. No. 333 is the Rural New Yorker Building which was

710143f-b.text:
Eighth Ave., north from West 30th Street, showing in a set of two views one of the main arterial thoroughfares of Manhattan and beneath whose street bed runs the Jndependent Eighth Ave. Subway, a Municipal venture. On the left is the general Post Office occupying the westerly front of the Avenue between 31st and 33rd Streets. The large light manufacturing building aeen,is at the N.W. corner of 33rd Street.
March 21, 1938.
P. L. Sperr.
The same, from another angle, showing Post Office
Suilding.
P. L. Sperr  September 2, 1940

403 Eighth Avenue at E. W. corner of 30th Street.
About 1913.
